availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Russell Hawkins (Franklin County, Kentucky, physician and clerk of the Kentucky Senate)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, physician and clerk. Virginia native. Married to Sarah Adeline Bowles Hawkins in Henrico County, Virginia, on March 9, 1825. Father of Joseph L. Hawkins, Mary E. Hawkins, James R. Hawkins, Jr., Julia L. Hawkins, Susan V. Hawkins, Mildred J. Hawkins, William B. Hawkins, and Hamilton P. Hawkins. Physician in Boone County, Kentucky, in 1850. Member of the Board of Visitors for the Kentucky Military Institute in Franklin County in 1853. Member of the Board of Visitors for the Kentucky Military Institute in Franklin County in 1855. Clerk of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1854 through 1859. Physician in Franklin County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Franklin County in 1860. Assistant clerk of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1861. Clerk of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1864 through 1866.
